intro: Borreria geeingwa, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Borreria geeingwa thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and rocky habitats.
